file_content.text: Thank you. We won't forget how you helped us.
We're going. Soon. I promise.
We just stopped to rest! Geozel found a scratch, and we don't know if it's the rakghoul infection, so we're waiting.
And Ferdoin might be coming down with Geonosian swamp flu, but we're on our way, I swear, and--
You're looking at me very strangely.
Are you part of the Outpost Four supply convoy?
Who are you?
Um, yes. Private Gilroh. I assumed you were looking for us.
What are you expecting me to accuse you of?
Feeling a little defensive?
Nothing! I mean, I know we're late, so people naturally start thinking....
That you were dead?
Thinking what?
Would they care?
I'm sorry. I shouldn't--are you even Republic? I don't recognize....
What are you trying to say?
Nothing. There's nothing to tell. I mean--
I'm Private Gilroh, Taris Outpost Four. I kind of assumed you were looking for our convoy.
We, uh, just stopped to rest. Sorry to trouble everyone.
You're forty-eight hours late. Have you been here that whole time?
What happened to you?
Um, yeah. Like I said, Ferdoin was hurt--I mean, Geozel, and--
Are you afraid of something? Is someone after you?
You look like you're hiding.
What isn't after us on this awful planet? The nexu, the--the blasted rakghouls!
Oh, forget it. I was never a good liar. We aren't going back, is that what you want to hear? We've deserted.
Do you think I'm stupid?
I'm a terrible liar. I hate lying. All I wanted was to serve the Republic, fight Imperials, see new parts of the galaxy.
I never asked to be sentenced to this forsaken hole.
So, fine, we deserted, all right? We're never going back there. I'd rather die.
Are conditions so bad you would turn against your every oath of loyalty?
Why?
I love the Republic, I do, but I've been here five years on a one-year tour. I've sent complaints, talked to psych counselors, nothing.
I feel your fear and anger tearing you apart. What did this?
What brought you to this?
Do you know what it's like here? You and the same two dozen guys, in total isolation, at the end of the galaxy.
What kind of man abandons his comrades in the face of such an enemy?
How could you do that?
Ha. We're not the only ones talking about running for it. We just got the first chance.
I know army life stinks, but don't they kill you or something if you desert?
Was it so bad?
Prison on Coruscant--which is way better than being stuck here. At least your family can visit!
You have a duty to the Republic.
You have to go back.
What about its duty to me?
Cut the hysterics.
You think I should calm down? Maybe I should tell you what it's like here.
Five years we've been out here, no break. Most of our friends have died. We're wounded, tired, broken.
Fighting something that can't think, can't be frightened. And if you get the slightest scratch, you become the enemy and your own squad puts you down like a dog!
You have given the Republic as much as it can reasonably demand.
You deserve a rest.
Y--you're not going to turn us in?
You'll never survive alone out here.
You should go somewhere safer.
Take this. It should be enough to buy a berth on a smuggler's ship.
I'll buy you a ticket home.
You... I can't... I mean, we thought we might get a spot with one of the scavengers, but then we heard they kill strangers on sight.
This--this would save my life. Maybe I can even get back in time to fix things with my girl.
You've been through enough.
We're heading back near the main base. There are scavengers with ships there. Maybe we can make it offworld.
Please, tell Commander Yajak that you found our bodies. That way no one will ever come looking.
You must return to your post. You knew the risks when you signed up.
Go back. It's your duty.
I--I can't. I'd rather kill myself, I really would.
Every soldier knows they might have to die for the Republic. What makes you so special?
Who should die in your place?
You think we didn't agonize about that? If we were fighting the Sith... if our deaths would mean something... there's nothing on Taris!
But they're right, guys. Without us, the outpost can't staff a full watch. How would we feel if the rakghouls got the lot of them?
But she's right, guys. Trying to defend the outpost down five men? The rakghouls'll get them all. And it will be our fault.
But he's right, guys. The outpost can barely staff a full watch as it is. The rakghouls will get the lot of them. I can't live with that.
I guess we have to go back. No matter what happens....
Don't make me force you.
All right. All right.
I'd rather die than go back, but I won't make that choice for the rest of these guys.
I hope they put you on the front lines to draw fire from the real soldiers.
You cowards deserve to die!
No, please! I'm not afraid of death. If only we were fighting the Sith--or something worthwhile!
But here? We're fighting rakghouls--dying on some forgotten planet at the far end of the galaxy. You don't care.
Just give us time to get our things together. We'll be back on base tonight. I promise.
We're just stopping to rest. Really.
